page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: This is a rural area dominated by woodland and pastoral land .The major settlement is the village of Blackboys which has a chapel, two inns and three food shops, one of which is also the village post office. The section also covers the western edge of Cross_in _ Hand village, which is about 3 km.west of Heathfield, and includes Cross_in_ Hand windmill. It is within an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. Blackboys lies at the junction of the roads from Heathfield to Lewes and Uckfield.It stands on a steeply, sloping ridge running from east to west. The main industries are agricultural though the nature of these has changed. A number of cottage industries have developed and the village has grown thoughout the years. Most residents now commute from Blackboys to their place of work.
